snippet: A freshman said she was sexually assaulted at Hobart and William Smith Colleges. The school’s handling of the investigation left her wishing she had remained silent.
abstract: New York Times examination of rape case at Hobart and William Smith Colleges offers rare look inside one school's adjudication of rape complaints amid roiling national debate over how best to stop sexual assaults on campuses; internal records depict a school ill prepared to evaluate such serious allegations; case shows that school disciplinary panels operate in secret with scant accountability and limited protections for accuser or accused.
lead_paragraph: A freshman said she was sexually assaulted at Hobart and William Smith Colleges. The school’s handling of the investigation left her wishing she had remained silent.

headline.seo: How One College Handled a Sexual Assault Complaint
headline.main: Reporting Rape, and Wishing She Hadn’t
headline.print_headline: Reporting Rape, and Wishing She Hadn’t
